During a five-year period from 1981 to 1986, we encountered 51 patients with primary soft-tissue infections caused by marine vibrios. Thirty-nine patients developed cellulitis after direct exposure to ocean water, nine had eaten raw oysters, and three had no obvious exposure to seawater.
